title: DASS Good: Explainable Data Mining of Spatial Cohort Data. (arXiv:2304.04870v1 [cs.HC])
abstract: Developing applicable clinical machine learning models is a difficult task when the data includes spatial information, for example, radiation dose distributions across adjacent organs at risk. We describe the co-design of a modeling system, DASS, to support the hybrid human-machine development and validation of predictive models for estimating long-term toxicities related to radiotherapy doses in head and neck cancer patients. Developed in collaboration with domain experts in oncology and data mining, DASS incorporates human-in-the-loop visual steering, spatial data, and explainable AI to augment domain knowledge with automatic data mining. We demonstrate DASS with the development of two practical clinical stratification models and report feedback from domain experts. Finally, we describe the design lessons learned from this collaborative experience.
context:
Title: DASS Good: Explainable Data Mining of Spatial Cohort Data. (arXiv:2304.04870v1 [cs.HC])
Abstract: Developing applicable clinical machine learning models is a difficult task when the data includes spatial information, for example, radiation dose distributions across adjacent organs at risk. We describe the co-design of a modeling system, DASS, to support the hybrid human-machine development and validation of predictive models for estimating long-term toxicities related to radiotherapy doses in head and neck cancer patients. Developed in collaboration with domain experts in oncology and data mining, DASS incorporates human-in-the-loop visual steering, spatial data, and explainable AI to augment domain knowledge with automatic data mining. We demonstrate DASS with the development of two practical clinical stratification models and report feedback from domain experts. Finally, we describe the design lessons learned from this collaborative experience.
translated_title: DASS Good: 解释性的空间队列数据挖掘方法
translated_abstract: 当数据包括空间信息时，例如邻近的有风险器官周围的辐射剂量分布，开发适用的临床机器学习模型是一项艰巨的任务。我们描述了一个建模系统DASS的协同设计，以支持人机混合开发和验证预测模型，用于估计头颈癌患者放疗剂量相关的长期毒副作用。与肿瘤学和数据挖掘领域专家合作开发的DASS，结合人-机循环视觉引导、空间数据和可解释的AI，以自动数据挖掘增加领域知识。我们使用两个实用的临床分层模型展示了DASS，并报告了领域专家的反馈。最后，我们描述了从这次协作经验中学到的设计经验。
tldr: 该论文描述了一个名为DASS的协同设计建模系统，结合人-机循环视觉引导、空间数据和可解释的AI，自动数据挖掘增加领域知识，在头颈癌患者的长期毒副作用预测模型开发中具有实际应用及领域专家反馈，为解决临床机器学习模型在数据包括空间信息时的困难提供了一种新兴方法。
en_tdlr: This paper describes a collaborative design modeling system called DASS which combines human-machine loop visual guidance, spatial data, and explainable AI to automatically mine data and augment domain knowledge, with practical clinical applications and expert feedback for predicting long-term toxic effects related to radiotherapy doses in head and neck cancer patients. It provides a novel approach to solve the difficulties of developing applicable clinical machine learning models when the data includes spatial information.
